column4: for future reference, the problem i had with vmware installation was related to the package "linux-headers" for my specific kernel.  to get the right headers the command i used was "sudo apt-get install linux-headers$(uname -r)"
if anybody asks about that in here, now i (and whoever read that) will have that in an IRC log
i'd think there would be a 686 build since i use a pentium 4 processor
also, would i benefit from using that kernel?
if its a HT proc then get the smp kernel
is your processor have hyper threading
i'm curious, why would i have found a package for 2.4.27 when everything is running on 2.6.15 now?  i didn't install it and used the guide tronica suggested instead
not sure why the 2.4's are still there.
